author: stsp
msg: * subversion/libsvn_subr/io.c
(get_default_file_perms): As part of fixing the recently introduced
permission problems due to restrictive permissions on temp files,
optimise a bit by getting permissions from the file handle rather than
statting the filename, and most importantly use svn_io_open_uniquely_named()
instead of svn_io_open_unique_file3() since the latter tweaks permissions
of files it creates, regardless of umask. Also, split off code into ...
(merge_default_file_perms): ... this new function for readability.
(io_set_file_perms): Call merge_default_file_perms().

author: stsp
msg: Changes made to svn_io_copy_perms() in r40275 weren't correct.
APR_OS_DEFAULT and apr_file_perms_set() don't play nicely together at all,
the result is not "set OS default permissions" but more like chmod(0xFFF).
* subversion/include/svn_io.h
(svn_io_copy_file): Revert documentation change from r40275.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/io.c
(svn_io_copy_file): Stop accepting SRC == NULL. Assume both SRC
and DST exist. If DST is a symlink, return early. Use the new
svn_io_file_perms_set() helper to trim down the code a bit.

author: stsp
msg: Add a wrapper for apr_file_perms_set().
* subversion/include/svn_io.h
(svn_io_file_perms_set): Declare.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/io.c
(svn_io_file_perms_set): New function.

author: rhuijben
msg: * subversion/libsvn_client/copy.c
(get_copy_pair_ancestors): Resolve two deprecation warnings by detecting
what kind of path is used and then using the type specific function.

author: stsp
msg: Revert r40333, it wasn't right. Copying permissions from the temporary
file to the destination is what we're trying to avoid, yet the "fix" did
just that.
